alert.note: Alert for McLennan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 7:06PM CDT until June 16 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following county, McLennan. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waco, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Woodway, Lacy-Lakeview, West, Mart, Beverly Hills, Lorena, Riesel, Golinda, Hallsburg, Northcrest, Tradinghouse Creek Reservoir, Lake Waco, Lake Creek Lake, China Spring, Gholson and Leroy.
